data.title: OnePlus launches 'OnePlus Fridays' with offers and rewards for its users
data.content: OnePlus has introduced the all-new 'OnePlus Fridays', a dedicated weekly initiative to provide exciting offers and rewards to the OnePlus community on its website every Friday. Starting tomorrow, users can purchase OnePlus products including the OnePlus Nord and OnePlus Buds through a special sale. Users can also avail a series of other exciting offers only on the brand’s website.
data.author: Roshan Gupta

data.title: Kangana calls Anurag 'mandbudhi' after his 'go fight China' tweet
data.content: Kangana Ranaut has called Anurag Kashyap "mandbudhi" after he tweeted, "Take four or five people and go fight China. Show them India has nothing to worry until you're there to protect us." Anurag's tweet came after Kangana tweeted, "I can allow my head to be severed, but won't bow it. I'll always raise my voice for honour of my nation."
data.author: Ankush Verma

data.title: Narendra Tomar given Harsimrat's portfolio after her resignation
data.content: President Ram Nath Kovind has accepted Harsimrat Kaur Badal's resignation from the Union Cabinet and directed that Cabinet minister Narendra Singh Tomar be assigned the additional charge of her portfolio. Notably, Kaur had resigned as Minister of Food Processing Industries in protest against three farm bills.
data.author: Aarushi Maheshwari

data.title: Many powers engaged in confusing farmers: PM Modi on farm bills
data.content: After Union Minister Harsimrat Kaur Badal resigned in protest against three agriculture reform bills, Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Thursday said, "Many powers are engaged in creating confusion among the farmers." He added, "These bills will truly free the farmers from middlemen and all obstacles...This bill will actually provide many more options to the farmers. They are truly empowering."
data.author: Aarushi Maheshwari

data.title: Bridge collapses, gets washed away ahead of its inauguration in Bihar
data.content: A bridge collapsed and was washed away ahead of its inauguration in Bihar, following a rise in the water levels of Kankai river in Kishanganj district on Thursday. The bridge, built at a cost of more than ₹1.42 crore, had to be completed by June 24 but was completed before time. Locals have alleged several irregularities in its construction.
data.author: Aarushi Maheshwari

data.title: Aim to bring India's COVID-19 mortality rate to below 1%: Centre
data.content: Health Minister Harsh Vardhan on Thursday stated that the Centre aims to bring down India's COVID-19 mortality rate to less than 1% from the current 1.64%. He added that India's mortality rate is the lowest in the world, while India's recovery rate of 78-79% is one of the highest in the world.
data.author: Aarushi Maheshwari

data.title: 2 minors arrested for killing their mother with iron rod in Odisha
data.content: Two minors have been arrested for allegedly killing their 40-year-old mother in Odisha's Bhubaneswar, said Bhubaneswar Deputy Commissioner of Police (DCP) Umashankar Dash on Thursday. "Last night, the trio had an argument which turned ugly. In a fit of rage, the duo allegedly attacked the victim with an iron rod which left her in a pool of blood," Dash added.
data.author: Aarushi Maheshwari

data.title: SBI makes OTP must for withdrawals above ₹10,000 at its ATMs 24x7
data.content: State Bank of India (SBI) has extended its OTP-based cash withdrawal for ₹10,000 and above throughout the day across all SBI ATMs from today. India's largest lender had initially introduced OTP-based cash withdrawals of above ₹10,000 between 8 pm and 8 am from January 1. Customers have been requested to carry their mobile phones while transacting at SBI ATMs.
data.author: Krishna Veera Vanamali

data.title: PM wasn't fully convinced of the idea to release ₹2,000 notes: Ex-aide
data.content: Nripendra Misra, who was the Principal Secretary to the Prime Minister during demonetisation, has revealed that PM Narendra Modi wasn't fully convinced of the idea to release new ₹2,000 notes but "went along with the consensus". "(PM) accepted the suggestion of those who felt that speedy printing of the high denomination note would increase the availability of cash," Misra added.
data.author: Krishna Veera Vanamali

data.title: Thai National Park sends trash back to litterers; minister shares pics
data.content: The Khao Yai National Park in Thailand is sending rubbish back to litterers, Thailand's Environment Minister Varawut Silpa-archa said. He posted pictures on Facebook of trash collected in cardboard parcels ready to be shipped. Visitors to the park have to register with their addresses, making it easy for park's authorities to track them down if they leave rubbish behind.
data.author: Ankush Verma

data.title: Fashion designer Sharbari Datta found dead at her home in Kolkata
data.content: Fashion designer Sharbari Datta has been found dead inside a washroom at her residence in Kolkata. Police has registered a case of unnatural death and the post mortem will be conducted today. "I'd last seen my mother on Wednesday. I didn't see her throughout Thursday. I thought she was busy and had gone out for work," her son said.
data.author: Ankush Verma

data.title: 53% of BSNL's mobile network equipment from 2 Chinese firms: Govt
data.content: The Communications Ministry has informed the Rajya Sabha that 44.4% of state-run BSNL's mobile network equipment comes from ZTE and another 9% from Huawei. Reliance Jio does not use equipment from these two Chinese vendors in its network, the ministry added. Telecom operators have been asked to carry out a special security audit of their network by an external agency.
data.author: Krishna Veera Vanamali

data.title: SC refuses to resume bankruptcy case against Anil Ambani
data.content: The Supreme Court on Friday rejected SBI's petition to allow a personal bankruptcy case against Anil Ambani to resume in connection with a ₹1,200-crore personal guarantee that he had given to the bank for loans to his companies. It directed the Delhi High Court to decide on Ambani's challenge to certain provisions of the Insolvency and Bankruptcy Code.
data.author: Krishna Veera Vanamali

data.title: Earned name after 1st film, yet struggled hard: Urmila on nepotism
data.content: Speaking to journalist Barkha Dutt about nepotism, actress Urmila Matondkar shared that she "struggled tremendously hard" despite making a "decent name" for herself after her first film. "By the time I was doing 'Rangeela', I was written off like no other actor in the history of cinema," she revealed. But I chose to let my work speak, Urmila added.
data.author: Vidushi Mishra

data.title: Ashley Tisdale, husband expecting first child together
data.content: American actress Ashley Tisdale and her husband Christopher French are expecting their first child together. Taking to their Instagram accounts on Thursday, the pair shared several pictures wherein French can be seen standing beside Ashley while she cradles her baby bump. "So happy for you guys. Congratulations," actress Vanessa Hudgens commented. "Omg congratulations!" wrote actress Kaley Cuoco.
data.author: Vidushi Mishra

data.title: Pune hospitals running out of remdesivir for COVID-19 patients
data.content: Several hospitals in Pune are facing a shortage of COVID-19 drug remdesivir, which is said to improve the recovery time of oxygen-assisted patients. The doctors at Rao Nursing Home said they got a limited supply of remdesivir as against the required stock. "We haven't received the supply even after paying for the drug," Noble Hospital's Executive Director HK Sale said.
data.author: Atul Mishra

data.title: 100-year-old Assam woman beats COVID-19, celebrates with songs
data.content: A 100-year-old woman from Guwahati, Assam, has recovered from COVID-19, state Health Minister Himanta Biswa Sarma said. Doctors said Mai Handique, who was hospitalised 11 days ago after testing positive, beat the virus with a positive frame of mind. Following her recovery, she sang several Assamese songs. "The nurses and doctors took very good care of me," Handique said.
data.author: Sharangee Dutta

data.title: Date to submit application for MU final exams extended till Sept 20
data.content: The date to submit applications for last year/semester exams of Mumbai University has been extended till September 20, Maharashtra Higher and Technical Education Minister Uday Samant announced on Thursday. "It's going to be an online exam but those who don't have the facility will be allowed to appear physically," he told reporters after conducting a review meeting.
data.author: Sharangee Dutta

data.title: Odisha records 3,607 new COVID-19 recoveries, tally touches 1,33,466
data.content: As many as 3,607 new COVID-19 recoveries have been reported in Odisha, taking the total number of recovered patients in the state to 1,33,466, according to the state government's COVID-19 dashboard. Meanwhile, the state's COVID-19 tally has reached 1,71,341 with 4,180 new positive cases. The death count has risen to 682 after 13 people succumbed to the infection.
data.author: Sharangee Dutta

data.title: 2 Greater Noida officials to be probed over work irregularities
data.content: Uttar Pradesh government has ordered a probe against two Greater Noida Industrial Development Authority senior officials for alleged work irregularities when both were posted at Yamuna Expressway Industrial Development Authority. One of the officials, a general manager, is accused of not executing works on decisions taken during meetings, an order by Additional Chief Secretary, Alok Kumar said.
data.author: Sharangee Dutta

data.title: Harsimrat's decision to quit Union Cabinet 'theatrics': Punjab CM
data.content: Punjab CM Captain Amarinder Singh has said that Harsimrat Kaur's decision to quit the Union Cabinet is "another in the long chain of theatrics being enacted by Akali Dal, which has still not quit ruling coalition". "It's motivated not by concern for farmers but to save their own dwindling political fortunes," he tweeted, adding, "Too little, too late."
data.author: Sharangee Dutta

data.title: Paintings of Hyderabad schoolgirl to adorn London restaurant
data.content: The paintings of a standard tenth schoolgirl, Syeda Ashna Turabi, from Hyderabad are set to adorn the walls of a restaurant in London. The restaurant will serve Hyderabadi food, and for the same, six of the girl's paintings have been selected. "My father started posting my paintings on social media, and from there I got [the order]," the girl said.
data.author: Atul Mishra

data.title: Farmers' body announces 'rail roko' protest against farm bills
data.content: Punjab's Kisan Mazdoor Sangharsh Committee will stage a 'rail roko' protest from September 24 to 26 against farm bills. Other farmer organisations have also called for a "bandh" on September 25. This comes after Lok Sabha on Thursday passed two farm bills. Notably, Harsimrat Kaur Badal of Shiromani Akali Dal resigned as Union Minister in protest against the bills.
data.author: Atul Mishra

data.title: BJP's Ashok Gasti, first-time Rajya Sabha MP from Karnataka, passes away
data.content: First-time BJP Rajya Sabha MP from Karnataka Ashok Gasti passed away on Thursday, days after testing positive for COVID-19. "He was critically ill with multi-organ failure on life support system in Intensive care unit," Hospital Director said. Condoling Gasti's demise, Vice President M Venkaiah Naidu said, "He was known for his simplicity and commitment for the upliftment of the downtrodden."
data.author: Kiran Khatri

data.title: Lakmé Fashion Week to hold first-ever digital edition in October
data.content: Lakmé Fashion Week's first-ever digital and season-fluid edition will be held from 21 to 25 October. The virtual event will go live on a virtual platform, which has been especially created for the fashion event. "With the first-ever digital edition, Lakmé Fashion Week will...put the spotlight back on the future of fashion," Ashwath Swaminathan, Head of Innovations at Lakmé, said.
data.author: Vidushi Mishra
